intro: Moraea curtisiae, commonly known as the Cape goldcup, is a striking South African bulbous plant belonging to the Iridaceae family. It features tall, narrow leaves and produces clusters of bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers with a distinctive golden center. The plant is native to the Western and Eastern Cape provinces, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Moraea curtisiae is typically found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. It is a popular choice for rock gardens due to its ornamental value and relatively low maintenance requirements.
